data.title: Global Parliamentary Alliance for Health, Rights and Development
data.meta_description: Advisory Group GPA is governed by an Advisory Group composed of leading parliamentarians from across the globe with a demonstrated commitment and track-record of championing health, human rights and the SDGs.
data.text:
The Global Parliamentary Alliance for Health, Rights and Development (GPA) is a flexible parliamentary initiative aimed at boosting parliamentarians' efforts to deliver on the SDGs, specifically in the areas of health and human rights. We provide a platform for parliamentarians from around the world to advocate for better health care, expanding human rights and to meet the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) both in their home countries and abroad.

Advisory Group

GPA is governed by an Advisory Group composed of leading parliamentarians from across the globe with a demonstrated commitment and track-record of championing health, human rights and the SDGs.

The GPA Advisory Group is currently composed of 11 MPs taking into account gender, political party and geographic balance and representatives of allied global organisations and agencies (such as UNFPA, WHO, Women Deliver, IPPF, others TBD). Parliamentary Members are invited to serve for a three-year term or until the end of their parliamentary mandate. The GPA Advisory Group meets twice per year in person or by conference-call.

GPA Mobile Application

The GPA Mobile app is the first global networking and knowledge-sharing tool for parliamentarians championing health, rights, and development. Download via the App Store or Google Play and register to receive access upon verification by the EPF Secretariat.

Download the app to:

Join the Global Parliamentary Alliance community

Connect and collaborate with other policy makers and human rights champions from around the world to accelerate the advancement of health, rights, and development everywhere.

Keep up with GPA events

RSVP to launch events, international conferences and parliamentarian study tours directly from the app, see and communicate with other participants, and receive logistical updates to your phone.

Access the key resources and policy recommendations

Bridge the gap between evidence-based health research and effective policy making, with up-to-date resources on more than 15 relevant topics.

Amplify your voice by coming together with other human rights advocates

Sign time-sensitive petitions defending human rights and draw on our campaign materials to use your platform to advocate for equal opportunities.‚Äù
